author: Staff Reporter
text:
Two Sabarimala pilgrims were killed on the spot and six others injured when their car proceeding to Palani from Sabaraimala collided head-on with a state transport corporation bus going to Madurai from Palani at Lakkayankottai near Oddanchatram on Sunday.

The deceased were identified as Jaan alias Janaki Raman and Raja of Chennai.

The police said that they could not identify the place of the deceased as well as the injured immediately as all the pilgrims were residing in different places in Chennai. The injured were unconscious. Information was passed on to their relatives.

We could identify them only after arrival of relatives to hospital, they added.

Meanwhile, six injured were shifted to Oddanchatram Government Hospital of which four were shifted to Madurai Government Rajaji Hospital as their condition was critical.

The police said that the Chennai-based Sabarimala pilgrims were going to Palani to have a darshan at Sri Dhandayuthapaniswamy Temple on their way back to Chennai from Sabarimala.

The accident took place as the bus collided head-on with their car on Palani-Dindigul Highway. Further investigation is on.
title: Two Sabarimala pilgrims killed; 6 injured in accident
